data.title: Preference to mute when leaving the window.

Renpy 6.99.4 (disregard the name of the folder).

data.title: zoom property of transform gets compounded on each showing of the displayable
data.body:
let's say the following code:

```
    test_image = Image('ava_armcross_neutral.png')
    transformed_image = Transform(test_image)
    transformed_image.zoom = 0.75
```

(note: no difference if I use Transform(test_image,zoom=0.75). problem persists.)
and then I show the transformed image with renpy.show() 

```
renpy.show('ava',what=transformed_image)
```

then every time I repeat this command the image gets a bit smaller. this happens even if the actual image is different but the tag is the same.

Am I doing something wrong or is this a bug?
here is a test project that showcases the problem: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bxi_SK2vLdpAT2lPVEhWSVFUUWc/view?usp=sharing

data.title: On ubuntu renpy.sh produces 'No module named _renpysteam' error
data.body:
Downloaded newest Renpy [Ren'Py 6.99.5.602] tar file extracted files and ran Renpy.sh file.
it created a log file with a 'No module named _renpysteam' error.

data.title: fix (py_)eval: allow evaling code objects
data.body:
The reason for this is that otherwise eval function available in
.rpy files is not fully compatible with regular python eval.

data.title: iOS scaling changed
data.body: Per: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=33217

data.title: imagebutton should give better error handling
data.body: When an auto file does not exist.

data.title: Smarter define
data.body: The define statement should know about config, style, and perhaps persistent/_preferences.

data.title: Pickle problem debugger.
data.body: Something that can be run to pickle all the things, in order to see what's causing a pickle problem.

data.title: Automatic backup of script files.
data.body: Developer-mode Ren'Py should automatically backup script files somewhere when they change. People lose game files too often.

data.title: It will be better if renpy supports customize plugins
data.body:
Compare with krkr2 and Ren'py engine, I noticed although krkr2 is a very simple engine that can only create some basic visual novel games, but it supports plugins. And we can use those plugins freely to make some advanced works. Like, I can use dynamic character images in the game, or multiple layers background, encrypt game scripts, even I can put a sub engine in it. These are not available in the original engine.
Look back to Ren'py, it contains complex source codes and some advanced functions, but I still feel not enough. Sometimes I want to create a Japanese-styled game, but Ren'py couldn't give me the things I want, or I have to look through a lot of instructions then understand how to use them. If we need to add some new things to engine, we still have to modify the source code rather than just realize them by put plugins inside my project.
I think Ren'py will be better if one day it can supports customize plugins. Engine just have to provide an interface and everyone can write their own plugins for it.

data.title: Music&Sound Volume controls is not working in 6.99.5.
data.body:
When I click each button until V6.99.4, it has changed the volume.
But in V6.99.5, when I click each button, it has changed to muted.
The code is changed?

Here is my code:

textbutton "Mute" action Preference("music mute", "toggle")
textbutton "Min" action Preference("music volume", 0.2)
textbutton "Medium" action Preference("music volume", 0.5)
textbutton "Loud" action Preference("music volume", 0.7)
textbutton "Max" action Preference("music volume", 1.0)

textbutton "Mute" action Preference("sound mute", "toggle")
textbutton "Min" action Preference("sound volume", 0.2)
textbutton "Medium" action Preference("sound volume", 0.5)
textbutton "Loud" action Preference("sound volume", 0.7)
textbutton "Max" action Preference("sound volume", 1.0)

data.title: None Editor
data.body: If the user clicks edit when the None editor is selected, we should prompt for an editor again.

data.title: Screen language: 'use', screen actions & screen variables don't work together
data.body:
When screen is embedded inside another screen with 'use' statement, actions which work with its variables (e.g. SetScreenVariable, ToggleScreenVariable) stop working properly. Perhaps this means that renpy.current_screen() does not work properly with nested screens.

https://github.com/caryoscelus/renpy-fail/blob/master/use-screen-variable-test/game/script.rpy

(Complete test game: https://github.com/caryoscelus/renpy-fail/tree/master/use-screen-variable-test)

data.title: Music room improvements
data.body:
Additionally, the imagebutton state for the Play button is selected only while the first song is playing, and changes to idle when the song changes. The imagebutton for the Stop button does not change to selected when the song stops. Is it possible to change these so that the Play button is selected when any song is playing and the Stop button is selected when no music is playing?

http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=33060

data.title: Add/doc function that forces integer scaling.
style_group at screen level.
data.body: and perhaps style_group "inherit"?

data.title: Won't run with > 4 non-ascii characters.
data.body: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=32977

data.title: sl2: Add should take None, do nothing.
Importing modules shadows Ren'Py imports
data.body:
Not a big issue, but just caught this behaviour. If there's a .py module imported from .rpy named ui (or perhaps any other name that is used by Ren'Py modules and exported to .rpy), starting game fails with following traceback:

```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "renpy/common/00start.rpy", line 148, in script call
    call _gl_test
  File "renpy/common/00gltest.rpy", line 358, in script
    $ __gl_test()
  File "renpy/common/00gltest.rpy", line 358, in <module>
    $ __gl_test()
  File "renpy/common/00gltest.rpy", line 284, in _m1_00gltest__gl_test
    _gl_performance_test()
  File "renpy/common/00gltest.rpy", line 300, in _gl_performance_test
    ui.pausebehavior(0)
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'pausebehavior'

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "renpy/bootstrap.py", line 281, in bootstrap
    renpy.main.main()
  File "renpy/main.py", line 466, in main
    run(restart)
  File "renpy/main.py", line 142, in run
    renpy.execution.run_context(True)
  File "renpy/execution.py", line 700, in run_context
    context.run()
  File "renpy/common/00start.rpy", line 148, in script call
    call _gl_test
  File "renpy/common/00gltest.rpy", line 358, in script
    $ __gl_test()
  File "renpy/ast.py", line 797, in execute
    renpy.python.py_exec_bytecode(self.code.bytecode, self.hide, store=self.store)
  File "renpy/python.py", line 1448, in py_exec_bytecode
    exec bytecode in globals, locals
  File "renpy/common/00gltest.rpy", line 358, in <module>
    $ __gl_test()
  File "renpy/common/00gltest.rpy", line 284, in _m1_00gltest__gl_test
    _gl_performance_test()
  File "renpy/common/00gltest.rpy", line 300, in _gl_performance_test
    ui.pausebehavior(0)
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'pausebehavior'

Linux-3.14-1-amd64-x86_64-with-debian-stretch-sid
Ren'Py 6.99.5.0
dracykeiton-demo 0.0.1
```

data.title: Add simplified_chinese template.
data.body:
I noticed that Ren'py did not have any simplified-chinese template in
GitHub, only one in our local blog, made by a Chinese guy who didn't
want to upload his work to GitHub, and now it's not downloadable. So I made a translation for free and
uploaded to Git, hopeing we can see it sooner or later.

data.title: added korean translation for tutorial
data.body:
Added Korean translation for tutorial game.
...I think every sentence makes sense. I guess...

data.title: Fix Nightly's translation
data.body:
It should be "", not "".
Old translation means "darkness version", not "nightly".

Variables to control skipping and dismissing pauses.

data.title: Fix callables in focus_mask.
data.body: focus_mask tried to use callable as displayable.

data.title: text_align in Character doesn't work
data.body:
$ narrator = Character(None, what_xalign=0.5, what_text_align=0.5, show_say_vbox_properties=dict(xalign=0.5)) 

all align parameters i remember = 0.5  text must be aligned by center. but align = 0 always, left side...
in which part i am wrong?

(Renpy v 6.99.4.467)
